seo.metaTitle: NWA Daily - A daily newsletter about all things Northwest Arkansas
seo.metaDescription: NWA Daily is a daily email newsletter that keeps readers up to date on the latest Northwest Arkansas news or NWA news in events, restaurants, business,  the community, politics, art, entertainment, culture, and sports in Northwest Arkansas including news about Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, and Fayetteville

posts.title: Fayetteville's Historic Ice House Sells Units For $1.47m
posts.content:
Three commercial units in Downtown Fayetteville's historic Ice House building have been purchased for $1.47m.

  • Fresh beets: The new owner, Dylan Maisel of New Orleans, plans to use the space to open a Northwest Arkansas location of his health restaurant and smoothie shop, The Daily Beet.
  • Welcome to the neighborhood: The Ice House, located at 339 N West Ave right off Dickson St, is a mixed-use building and home to Ice House Tattoo, In Motion Boutique, and several residential units.

Read about this development and more from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Your Guide To The Ultimate Northwest Arkansas Valentine's Date
posts.content:
Valentine's Day is right around the corner, and we're here to help you be prepared! Check out our guide to Date Night Spots Around NWA and set up a reservation for you and your special someone.

  • Comfy: If you're keeping it cool this Valentine's, some of our favorite options that feel upscale yet casual are MJ Pizzeria, Local Lime, and Louise at Thaden Field.
  • Classy: Want to put on the ritz and hit the town in style? Make a reservation at one of these fancy establishments: Atlas, The Preacher's Son, or the Heirloom at 1907.

Find descriptions of these spots and more in our guide HERE.

posts.title: Crystal Bridges Announces Exhibitions Coming In 2023
posts.content:
From Diego Rivera to Annie Leibovitz, the 2023 Exhibition lineup at Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art will feature some of the most iconic artists of the twentieth and twenty-first centuries.

  • A lasting vision: Deigo Rivera's America brings together over 150 of Rivera's art pieces, examining the social and cultural life of Mexico and America from the 1920s to the 1940s, in the first major exhibition focused exclusively on the Mexican artist in over 20 years.
  • Say cheese: One of the most accomplished photographers of the last fifty years, Annie Leibovitz has highlighted society in publications like The Rolling Stone, Vanity Fair, and Vogue. Annie Leibovitz: Portraits explores American identities, human relationships, current events, and more through her thoughtful photography.

Find these exhibitions and more in the 2023 lineup HERE.

posts.title: Freedom's Path Hits Theaters This February
posts.content:
Produced by Fayettevlle-based Rockhill Studios, the civil-war era story Freedom's Path will debut on Feb 3, showing locally at AMC Fiesta Square in Fayetteville.

  • The plot: According to Screenrant, the story follows the Union soldier William, who intentionally injures himself and deserts battle to avoid death but gets caught up in the crossfires of Confederates hunting a group of Black fighters. 
  • Hey, I've been there: The movie was primarily filmed in the fall of 2019 at multiple Northwest Arkansas locations like Prairie Grove Battlefield Park, War Eagle Mill, Lincoln, Cane Hill, and more.

Watch the movie trailer HERE, and book tickets HERE.

posts.title: Elle King Joins The Lineup Of FreshGrass | Bentonville
posts.content:
Multi-platinum artist Elle King has been added to the lineup for FreshGrass | Bentonville, joining the outstanding bluegrass and roots artists coming to Bentonville on May 19-20.

  • Music connects: Alongside bands like Caamp, Mavis Staples, and Sierra Ferrell, the festival will also include FreshSongs, first-time music performances created by international songwriters at The House of Songs exclusively for the festival.
  • Movies and more: Beyond the music, the family-friendly festival will offer activities, local food and drink, local vendors, food and beverages, and a viewing of FreshScores, a silent film featuring original live music.

Read more about the upcoming festival HERE.

posts.title: ICYMI: Become a Fan of NWA Daily
posts.content:
Hey friends, we wanted to share a little update about NWA Daily! We've come a long way since we began in early 2021, from just an idea to over 23,000 subscribers. We've had a blast curating content and keeping you up-to-date and connected in NWA, and we are so thankful for all of you!

  • In the beginning: A little bit about us. We're just two couples that love NWA and want others to know and love it like we do! We have been running NWA Daily on the side and bootstrapping it with our own resources since the very beginning.
  • What's next: In an effort to continue to provide you with the best and most relevant content in a fun and efficient way, we're expanding our team, aiming to bring on a new full-time hire in the next few months! In conjunction with this, we're launching a reader revenue program where you can become a 'Fan' of NWA Daily through voluntary financial contributions to help us achieve goals like hiring new full-time team members!

In addition to helping us bring you better content, becoming a fan will also give you access to exclusive giveaways from our local partners. If you've enjoyed following along and have learned something new about NWA from us, we hope that you consider supporting us HERE.

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas Ranked 4th Best Places To Buy A Home In 2023
posts.content:
The Northwest Arkansas metro area was ranked the 4th best place to buy a home in 2023 by the National Association of Realtors.

  • Rapid growth: The population of Northwest Arkansas is growing at an annual rate of 2% compared to the national average of just .01%.
  • Better prices: The region ranked 2nd on the list regarding housing affordability with a median home price of $328,400 compared to the 2022 national median of $379,100.

Watch the KNWA news story HERE.

posts.title: Hugo's Of Fayetteville Nominated For Arkansas Food Hall Of Fame
posts.content:
Fayetteville's vibiest burger joint has been nominated for the 2023 class of the Arkansas Food Hall of Fame.

  • Basement burger: Located in the basement at 25 1/2 N Block Ave, Hugo's has been serving up a delicious menu since 1977, but their specialty is a top-class burger paired with homemade fries.
  • Best in state: Arkansas Heritage began the Arkansas Food Hall of Fame in 2016 to honor the great food traditions of Arkansas and the people who make them. Hugo's was the only restaurant nominated out of Northwest Arkansas this year.

See a complete list of finalists in About You HERE.

posts.title: Get Ready for Loma's Grand Opening Tomorrow
posts.content:
It's time - Loma, launched by one of the owners of Tula in Fayetteville, officially opens tomorrow! We had a chance to get a sneak peek and dine at the restaurant last week, and we just couldn't wait to tell you about it.

  • A feast for the eyes: The stunning 9,000 sqft restaurant was designed by a Mexico City architecture firm and gives off the perfect warm and cozy vibes. And, when NWA isn't blanketed in snow or ice, there is an enormous rooftop patio to enjoy. Located in the ONE Uptown building, the location is prime and is another A+ addition to the Pinnacle Hills area.
  • A taste of Mexico: In addition to some of the classics we've come to know and love at Tula like the Guacamole and the Cochinita Pibil, we also tried some delicious plates exclusive to Loma. The Pork Belly Carnitas and and Chicharron De Ribeye were fantastic, savory starters. We finished the meal with Ahi Tuna which was incredibly fresh and flavorful and the Barbacoa, which was fall-off-the-bone tender and packed with flavor.

Go ahead and start making your reservations and see for yourself why the NWA Daily crew is already planning our return.

posts.title: NWA Food Bank Takes A Stand Against Hunger
posts.content:
The Northwest Arkansas Food Bank is making a difference in the fight against hunger. In 2021, they distributed over 14m lbs of food and currently have over 110 partner agencies across Benton, Carroll, Madison, and Washington counties.

  • The rent eats first: Housing affordability directly impacts food insecurity. NWA Food Bank and organizations like Hark at Excellerate Foundation are exploring ways to help our community grow strategically, so we don't leave our most vulnerable neighbors hungry.
  • Good work: Many volunteer opportunities are available at the Food Bank, such as serving in the warehouse, volunteering at a mobile food pantry, or working in the Food Bank's garden.

Learn more about the NWA Food Bank HERE.

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas Tourism Nominated For Multiple Awards
posts.content:
Multiple attractions and groups from Northwest Arkansas have been nominated for Henry Awards, statewide awards given to those who have made significant contributions to the state's tourism industry.

  • Places of innovation: The Railyard Park & Butterfield Stage of Rogers and Experience Fayetteville's ArtCourt have both been nominated for The Natural State Tourism Development Award for creatively increasing community engagement. 
  • People of interest: Experience Fayetteville has been nominated for the Tourism Organization of the Year, and Luke Wiggins of Visit Rogers has been selected as a Rising Star for demonstrating leadership and commitment to the state's tourism industry.

Read more on the story HERE.

posts.title: Let Off Some Steam At The NWA Smash Lab
posts.content:
Ever wanted to take a baseball bat to your computer when the internet's slow? Hypothetically speaking, of course... However, at NWA Smash Lab, you can literally smash away your stress in a safer, more controlled environment.

  • Choose your weapon: Select your tool from the Weapon Wall, including sledgehammers, golf clubs, bats, and more, and swing away at bottles, glass plates, or old electronics. Make it a Premium session for access to BB gun shooting or glass bottle bowling!
  • Bonding by breaking: Reservations can be made for individuals or groups, and packages are available for corporate events looking for a fun way to do some team building.

Learn more and book a smash session HERE.

posts.title: $240m Of NWA's Medicare Expenses Spent Outside Of Region
posts.content:
According to the Arkansas Center for Health Improvement's analysis of Northwest Arkansas in 2019, nearly $240m of the $1.1b spent on Medicare enrollee's healthcare went towards services provided outside of the region.

  • Finding specialists: Considering cardiology procedures performed on Medicare-enrolled residents, 11% sought care outside of Northwest Arkansas. Specifically, 14% of coronary artery bypass grafting surgeries and 20% of heart valve replacement surgeries occurred outside the region.
  • Keeping pace: These findings raise concerns about the supply and demand for healthcare providers in Northwest Arkansas. As the population grows, our health sector has a unique opportunity to expand and innovate.

Listen to KUAF for more of the story HERE.

posts.title: Adventure Racing World Series Finds A New Home In NWA
posts.content:
The Adventure Racing World Series has been purchased from the Australian-based Geocentric Outdoors by current CEO Heidi Muller, who plans to move the organization's headquarters to Bentonville.

  • Extreme sports: Adventure races combine disciplines like trekking, rock climbing, paddling, mountain biking, and orienteering as teams traverse huge distances over days-long races—a perfect sport for the rugged Ozarks.
  • Natural State: Three private investors from NWA aided the purchase, two of which, Jason Wilford and Philip Sigsworth, are board members of Ozark Outdoor Foundation, which hosts Expedition Ozark, a 5-day, 390mi adventure race including biking, trekking, and paddling.

Read the full story from Arkansas Outdoors HERE.

posts.title: House Show Music Festival Coming To Bentonville This April
posts.content:
Music and hospitality will collide during City Sessions' 4th annual Home Sweet Home Music Festival in Downtown Bentonville on April 28-29.

  • In the house: This music-filled weekend will consist of 50 shows featuring 23 local artists and ten national artists hosted across 14 homes in Downtown Bentonville. Some exciting headliners include David Ramirez, Joshua James, Stephen Day, and Ira Wolf.
  • Come on in: Day passes are $60, which includes three shows plus the headliner and refreshments, or pick up a Weekend Pass, a $120 value, for just $100 when you use the discount code HSH23. If you're a superfan, the $250 Wheelhouse VIP pass includes a private show with Ira Wolf and Will Gunselman catered by Conifer at the Howard.

Find more information and reserve your tickets HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
After a long week of heavy snow and power outages, we wish you all a fun and relaxing weekend in Northwest Arkansas. You've earned it!

  • Peak health: The 2023 NWA Health Summit is today, Jan 27, from 9a-4p at the Jones Center in Springdale. See this schedule for a list of sessions and speakers.
  • Got lunch? Bentonville friends, head over to the grand opening of The Beach BBQ at 1080 SE 14th St today at 11:30a, and let us know what you think of NWA's newest barbecue joint!
  • Taking the stage: Head to TheatreSquared for the opening night of Kim's Convenience tonight, Jan 27, at 7:30p, or catch one of the showings on Saturday or the Sunday matinee.
  • Stick the landing: Help the Arkansas gymnastics team "Stripe the Barn" as they take on No. 8 LSU tonight, Jan 27, at 7:45p in Barnhill Arena.
  • Caffriends: Take your friends out for coffee and great conversation during the Fayetteville Coffee Crawl beginning today, Jan 27, and lasting through next week!
  • 90's kids: Reminisce over the '90s at George's Majestic Lounge in Fayetteville during a Gin & Juice: A Tribute to 90's Hip Hop this Saturday, Jan 28, at 9p.

We'll see you back here next week! Have a great Friday.

posts.title: New Exhibition On Display At Crystal Bridges
posts.content:
This weekend, Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art will open a free exhibition featuring selections from the Alfred Stieglitz Collection entitled Seeing One Another. The exhibit will be displayed in the Modern Art Gallery from Jan 28 until the end of the year.

  • Perspectives: Seeing One Another highlights multiple insights into how works of art connect individuals, groups, and ideas across time, embodying stories that can be understood in varying ways depending on the viewer.
  • Global story: Co-owned by Crystal Bridges and Fisk University, the Alfred Stieglitz Collection includes works by African, European, and American artists exploring themes of portraiture, family, and legacy.

Find more information and plan your visit HERE.

posts.title: Chef Rafael Rios Of Yeyo's Named A James Beard Best Chef Semifinalist
posts.content:
Continuing to make the headlines as one of Northwest Arkansas's most well-respected chefs, Chef Rafael Rios of Yeyo's has been announced as a James Beard Awards semifinalist in the Best Chef: South category.

  • Prestige: The James Beard Foundation has been calling attention to extraordinary people behind America's food culture for over 30 years. Winners will be celebrated at the James Beard Restaurant and Chef Awards Ceremony on June 5 at the Lyric Opera in Chicago. We're cheering on Chef Rafael as he represents NWA!
  • Andale: Yeyo's El Alma de Mexico began in 2012 out of a bright yellow food truck and has since grown into a thriving, multi-location establishment, including the Restaurant in Bentonville, the Mezcaleria y Taqueria in Downtown Rogers, the Yellow Foodtruck at the Bentonville Square, and the Blue Foodtruck at Natural State Beer Co.

Follow Yeyo's on Instagram to stay updated HERE.

posts.title: Conversate And Caffeinate During The Fayetteville Coffee Crawl
posts.content:
Take a tour of Fayetteville's coffee scene during the Fayetteville Coffee Crawl, beginning this Friday, Jan 27, and lasting until Feb 3.

  • Gotta try 'em all: Stamp cards will be available at Puritan and Summer Moon. Visit at least seven of the ten participating shops to be eligible for prizes.
  • Sip and share: The Fayetteville Coffee Crawl was dreamt up by local Emma Nelson, who wanted to share her enjoyment of great conversations and genuine community that can form across the coffee table.

Find all the information you need right HERE.

posts.title: With Incredible Sushi, Fresh Seafood, and Creative Dishes, Blu Rogers is a Must Try
posts.content:
Located in a place that is likely familiar to longtime Rogers residents, Blu Rogers recently opened in Downtown Rogers in the old City Hall building.

  • Top chef: A sister restaurant to Blu in Bentonville, Blu Rogers prides itself on having the highest quality and purest tasting fish and seafood. Familiar with the concept, we checked out this location for the first time last week for lunch!
  • Served up: We went with the Blu specials - udon soup, seasoned shishito peppers, ahi tuna salad, and the fiery whipple roll. While there are plenty of great options for dinner at Blu DTR, this was the perfect combo for our lunch there.

If you like seafood, Blu Rogers should definitely be on your list, because they do it right! Learn more about Blu Rogers HERE.

posts.title: Let Me Take A Selfie During The First Ever SNAPS NWA
posts.content:
Immerse yourself in local art and capture a one-of-a-kind selfie during the first-ever SNAPS Selfie Pop-Up event hosted by Brick & Mortar and Arli Media in Downtown Rogers at 120 W Walnut St.

  • In focus: Interact with the creations of five regional artists, photographing yourself and your friends in each of the unique "snap spots" based on February's theme: All You Need Is Love.
  • Set a time: Join the VIP Night on Thursday, Feb 2, including a meet and greet with the artists, appetizers by The Sous Chef, drinks, and more. General admission will be available Friday, Feb 3, through Sunday, Feb 5.

Reserve a session for yourself or an entire group HERE.

posts.title: University Of Arkansas Ranks High For Online Programs
posts.content:
The University of Arkansas ranked No. 35 overall for online bachelor's programs in U.S. News & World Report's 2023 list of "Best Online Programs."

  • Best in the biz: The Walton College of Business ranked No. 12 nationally in the subcategory for Online Bachelor's in Business programs.
  • Make it a master's: The state's flagship university also ranked well for multiple master's degree programs, coming in at No. 42 in Engineering, No. 74 in Education, and No. 122 in Nursing.

Read more about the U of A's online degree programs HERE.

posts.title: Executive Order Leads To Creation Of State Council For Outdoor Recreation
posts.content:
One of the latest executive orders by Gov. Sarah Huckabee Sanders will establish the Natural State Initiative and Natural State Advisory Council to promote outdoor recreation and increase public health and tourism.

  • All natural: In 2021, outdoor recreation generated $3.5b and 40,000 jobs for the state. This order aims to leverage that momentum to establish Arkansas as a leader in the outdoor economy.
  • Pacesetters: Northwest Arkansas has been a leading region for the state in developing outdoor recreation opportunities thanks to initiatives by groups like the NWA Council, Walton Family Foundation, and the NWA Regional Planning Commission.

Read more on the story HERE.
